EMERGENCY LOG

shutdown triggered 6.4
earthquake. Cascading
failures across southern
hemisphere.

[ORSA-NODE-STATUS]

[ORSA-NODE-STATUS]
COMPENSATION FAILING
ORBITAL DRIFT: +0.003 AU

VASQUEZ PERSONAL LOG:

Shutting down locally makes
it worse. The remaining
nodes compensate by drawing
more power, which accelerates
their own failure.

ORSA can no longer be
disabled piecemeal.

Local shutdown attempts
amplified orbital instability.

This is irreversible.

The math is clear. Even if
every node came back online
today, the orbital momentum
cannot be corrected.

Geothermal stabilization
nodes are the last option.

Go deep. The thermal anchors
can create bubbles of
survivability.

I'm heading underground.
I suggest you do the same.

-E.V.

POST-SCRIPT:

The relay satellites launched
last week. Seven of them.
Project Lighthouse.

They'll keep listening even
after the last node goes
dark. Even after we leave.

If someone builds the
transponder, the satellites
will hear it.

I don't know if anyone will
be left to try.

But at least the sky is
listening.

-E.V.
